enable_beta_resources.description: Enable beta resources. Default is false.

opensearch_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the OpenSearch service

postgresflex_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the PostgresFlex service

private_key.description: Private RSA key used for authentication, relevant for the key flow. It takes precedence over the private key that is included in the service account key.

private_key_path.description: Path for the private RSA key used for authentication, relevant for the key flow. It takes precedence over the private key that is included in the service account key.

rabbitmq_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the RabbitMQ service

redis_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Redis service

region.description: Region will be used as the default location for regional services. Not all services require a region, some are global

service_account_email.description: Service account email. It can also be set using the environment variable STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL. It is required if you want to use the resource manager project resource.

service_account_key.description: Service account key used for authentication. If set, the key flow will be used to authenticate all operations.

service_account_key_path.description: Path for the service account key used for authentication. If set, the key flow will be used to authenticate all operations.

service_account_token.description: Token used for authentication. If set, the token flow will be used to authenticate all operations.

service_enablement_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Service Enablement API

ske_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Kubernetes Engine (SKE) service

sqlserverflex_custom_endpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the SQL Server Flex service

acl.description: The access control list for this instance. Each entry is an IP address range that is permitted to access, in CIDR notation.

opsgenie_api_url.description: The host to send OpsGenie API requests to. Must be a valid URL

resolve_timeout.description: The default value used by alertmanager if the alert does not include EndsAt. After this time passes, it can declare the alert as resolved if it has not been updated. This has no impact on alerts from Prometheus, as they always include EndsAt.

smtp_auth_identity.description: SMTP authentication information. Must be a valid email address

smtp_auth_password.description: SMTP Auth using LOGIN and PLAIN.

smtp_auth_username.description: SMTP Auth using CRAM-MD5, LOGIN and PLAIN. If empty, Alertmanager doesn't authenticate to the SMTP server.

smtp_from.description: The default SMTP From header field. Must be a valid email address

smtp_smart_host.description: The default SMTP smarthost used for sending emails, including port number in format `host:port` (eg. `smtp.example.com:587`). Port number usually is 25, or 587 for SMTP over TLS (sometimes referred to as STARTTLS).

auth_identity.description: SMTP authentication information. Must be a valid email address

from.description: The sender email address. Must be a valid email address

smart_host.description: The SMTP host through which emails are sent.

to.description: The email address to send notifications to. Must be a valid email address

api_url.description: The host to send OpsGenie API requests to. Must be a valid URL

tags.description: Comma separated list of tags attached to the notifications.

ms_teams.description: Microsoft Teams webhooks require special handling, set this to true if the webhook is for Microsoft Teams.

url.description: The endpoint to send HTTP POST requests to. Must be a valid URL

group_by.description: The labels by which incoming alerts are grouped together. For example, multiple alerts coming in for cluster=A and alertname=LatencyHigh would be batched into a single group. To aggregate by all possible labels use the special value '...' as the sole label name, for example: group_by: ['...']. This effectively disables aggregation entirely, passing through all alerts as-is. This is unlikely to be what you want, unless you have a very low alert volume or your upstream notification system performs its own grouping.

group_interval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification about new alerts that are added to a group of alerts for which an initial notification has already been sent. (Usually ~5m or more.)

group_wait.description: How long to initially wait to send a notification for a group of alerts. Allows to wait for an inhibiting alert to arrive or collect more initial alerts for the same group. (Usually ~0s to few minutes.)

match.description: A set of equality matchers an alert has to fulfill to match the node.

match_regex.description: A set of regex-matchers an alert has to fulfill to match the node.

receiver.description: The name of the receiver to route the alerts to.

repeat_interval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification again if it has already been sent successfully for an alert. (Usually ~3h or more).

is_updatable.description: Specifies if the instance can be updated.

metrics_retention_days.description: Specifies for how many days the raw metrics are kept.

metrics_retention_days_1h_downsampling.description: Specifies for how many days the 1h downsampled metrics are kept. must be less than the value of the 5m downsampling retention. Default is set to `0` (disabled).

metrics_retention_days_5m_downsampling.description: Specifies for how many days the 5m downsampled metrics are kept. must be less than the value of the general retention. Default is set to `0` (disabled).

primaries.description: Primary name server for secondary zone. E.g. ["1.2.3.4"]

external_address.description: External Load Balancer IP address where this Load Balancer is exposed.

id.description: Terraform's internal resource ID. It is structured as "`project_id`","`name`".

port.description: Port number where we listen for traffic.

protocol.description: Protocol is the highest network protocol we understand to load balance. Supported values are: `PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED`, `PROTOCOL_TCP`, `PROTOCOL_UDP`, `PROTOCOL_TCP_PROXY`, `PROTOCOL_TLS_PASSTHROUGH`.

name.description: A domain name to match in order to pass TLS traffic to the target pool in the current listener

server_name_indicators.description: A list of domain names to match in order to pass TLS traffic to the target pool in the current listener

target_pool.description: Reference target pool by target pool name.

listeners.description: List of all listeners which will accept traffic. Limited to 20.

role.description: The role defines how the load balancer is using the network. Supported values are: `ROLE_UNSPECIFIED`, `ROLE_LISTENERS_AND_TARGETS`, `ROLE_LISTENERS`, `ROLE_TARGETS`.

networks.description: List of networks that listeners and targets reside in.

acl.description: Load Balancer is accessible only from an IP address in this range.

private_network_only.description: If true, Load Balancer is accessible only via a private network IP address.

options.description: Defines any optional functionality you want to have enabled on your load balancer.

private_address.description: Transient private Load Balancer IP address. It can change any time.

project_id.description: STACKIT project ID to which the Load Balancer is associated.

healthy_threshold.description: Healthy threshold of the health checking.

interval.description: Interval duration of health checking in seconds.

interval_jitter.description: Interval duration threshold of the health checking in seconds.

timeout.description: Active health checking timeout duration in seconds.

unhealthy_threshold.description: Unhealthy threshold of the health checking.

use_source_ip_address.description: If true then all connections from one source IP address are redirected to the same target. This setting changes the load balancing algorithm to Maglev.

session_persistence.description: Here you can setup various session persistence options, so far only "`use_source_ip_address`" is supported.

target_port.description: Identical port number where each target listens for traffic.

targets.description: List of all targets which will be used in the pool. Limited to 1000.

target_pools.description: List of all target pools which will be used in the Load Balancer. Limited to 20.

credentials_ref.description: The credentials reference can be used for observability of the Load Balancer.

allow_privileged_containers.description:
Flag to specify if privileged mode for containers is enabled or not.
This should be used with care since it also disables a couple of other features like the use of some volume type (e.g. PVCs).
Deprecated as of Kubernetes 1.25 and later

allowed_cidrs.description: Specify a list of CIDRs to whitelist.

zones.description: Specify a list of domain filters for externalDNS (e.g., `foo.runs.onstackit.cloud`)

end.description: End time of hibernation in crontab syntax. E.g. `0 8 * * *` for waking up the cluster at 8am.

start.description: Start time of cluster hibernation in crontab syntax. E.g. `0 18 * * *` for starting everyday at 6pm.

timezone.description: Timezone name corresponding to a file in the IANA Time Zone database. i.e. `Europe/Berlin`.

hibernations.description: One or more hibernation block as defined below.

id.description: Terraform's internal resource ID. It is structured as "`project_id`,`name`".

kube_config.description: Static token kubeconfig used for connecting to the cluster. This field will be empty for clusters with Kubernetes v1.27+, or if you have obtained the kubeconfig or performed credentials rotation using the new process, either through the Portal or the SKE API. Use the stackit_ske_kubeconfig resource instead. For more information, see [How to rotate SKE credentials](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/how-to-rotate-ske-credentials-200016334.html).

kubernetes_version.description: Kubernetes version. Must only contain major and minor version (e.g. 1.22). This field is deprecated, use `kubernetes_version_min instead`

kubernetes_version_min.description: The minimum Kubernetes version. This field will be used to set the minimum kubernetes version on creation/update of the cluster. If unset, the latest supported Kubernetes version will be used. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html). To get the current kubernetes version being used for your cluster, use the read-only `kubernetes_version_used` field.

kubernetes_version_used.description: Full Kubernetes version used. For example, if 1.22 was set in `kubernetes_version_min`, this value may result to 1.22.15. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html).

enable_kubernetes_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the Kubernetes version. Defaults to `true`. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html).

enable_machine_image_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the OS image version. Defaults to `true`. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html).

end.description: Time for maintenance window end. E.g. `01:23:45Z`, `05:00:00+02:00`.

start.description: Time for maintenance window start. E.g. `01:23:45Z`, `05:00:00+02:00`.

maintenance.description: A single maintenance block as defined below.

id.description: ID of the STACKIT Network Area (SNA) network into which the cluster will be deployed.

availability_zones.description: Specify a list of availability zones. E.g. `eu01-m`

cri.description: Specifies the container runtime. Defaults to `containerd`

labels.description: Labels to add to each node.

max_surge.description: Maximum number of additional VMs that are created during an update. If set (larger than 0), then it must be at least the amount of zones configured for the nodepool. The `max_surge` and `max_unavailable` fields cannot both be unset at the same time.

max_unavailable.description: Maximum number of additional VMs that are created during an update. If set (larger than 0), then it must be at least the amount of zones configured for the nodepool. The `max_surge` and `max_unavailable` fields cannot both be unset at the same time.

maximum.description: Maximum number of nodes in the pool.

minimum.description: Minimum number of nodes in the pool.

name.description: Specifies the name of the node pool.

os_name.description: The name of the OS image. Defaults to `flatcar`.

os_version.description: This field is deprecated, use `os_version_min` to configure the version and `os_version_used` to get the currently used version instead.

os_version_min.description: The minimum OS image version. This field will be used to set the minimum OS image version on creation/update of the cluster. If unset, the latest supported OS image version will be used. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html). To get the current OS image version being used for the node pool, use the read-only `os_version_used` field.

os_version_used.description: Full OS image version used. For example, if 3815.2 was set in `os_version_min`, this value may result to 3815.2.2. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html).

Before deleting this resource, all SKE clusters associated to the project must be deleted. Otherwise, error would occur due to the existing clusters. In such case, it is highly recommended to remove the SKE project from the state, directly using the "`terraform state rm`". Warning: SKE project resource is no longer in use and will be removed after October 10th 2024. SKE service enablement is done automatically when a new cluster is created.

group_by.description: The labels by which incoming alerts are grouped together. For example, multiple alerts coming in for cluster=A and alertname=LatencyHigh would be batched into a single group. To aggregate by all possible labels use the special value '...' as the sole label name, for example: group_by: ['...']. This effectively disables aggregation entirely, passing through all alerts as-is. This is unlikely to be what you want, unless you have a very low alert volume or your upstream notification system performs its own grouping.

group_interval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification about new alerts that are added to a group of alerts for which an initial notification has already been sent. (Usually ~5m or more.)

group_wait.description: How long to initially wait to send a notification for a group of alerts. Allows to wait for an inhibiting alert to arrive or collect more initial alerts for the same group. (Usually ~0s to few minutes.) .

match.description: A set of equality matchers an alert has to fulfill to match the node.

match_regex.description: A set of regex-matchers an alert has to fulfill to match the node.

receiver.description: The name of the receiver to route the alerts to.

repeat_interval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification again if it has already been sent successfully for an alert. (Usually ~3h or more).

labels.description: Labels are key-value string pairs which can be attached to a resource container. A label key must match the regex [A-ZÄÜÖa-zäüöß0-9_-]{1,64}. A label value must match the regex ^$|[A-ZÄÜÖa-zäüöß0-9_-]{1,64}

role.description: The role of the member in the project. Legacy roles (`project.admin`, `project.auditor`, `project.member`, `project.owner`) are not supported.

subject.description: Unique identifier of the user, service account or client. This is usually the email address for users or service accounts, and the name in case of clients.

members.description:
The members assigned to the project. At least one subject needs to be a user, and not a client or service account. This value is only considered during creation. Changing it afterwards will have no effect.

!> The "members" field has been deprecated in favor of the "owner_email" field. Please use the "owner_email" field to assign the owner role to a user.

owner_email.description: Email address of the owner of the project. This value is only considered during creation. Changing it afterwards will have no effect.

parent_container_id.description: Parent resource identifier. Both container ID (user-friendly) and UUID are supported

allow_privileged_containers.description:
DEPRECATED as of Kubernetes 1.25+
 Flag to specify if privileged mode for containers is enabled or not.
This should be used with care since it also disables a couple of other features like the use of some volume type (e.g. PVCs).

allowed_cidrs.description: Specify a list of CIDRs to whitelist

argus.description: A single argus block as defined below

zones.description: Specify a list of domain filters for externalDNS (e.g., `foo.runs.onstackit.cloud`)

extensions.description: A single extensions block as defined below

end.description: End time of hibernation, in crontab syntax.

start.description: Start time of cluster hibernation in crontab syntax.

timezone.description: Timezone name corresponding to a file in the IANA Time Zone database.

hibernations.description: One or more hibernation block as defined below.

id.description: Terraform's internal data source. ID. It is structured as "`project_id`,`name`".

kube_config.description: Kube config file used for connecting to the cluster. This field will be empty for clusters with Kubernetes v1.27+, or if you have obtained the kubeconfig or performed credentials rotation using the new process, either through the Portal or the SKE API. Use the stackit_ske_kubeconfig resource instead. For more information, see How to rotate SKE credentials (https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/how-to-rotate-ske-credentials-200016334.html).

kubernetes_version.description: Kubernetes version. This field is deprecated, use `kubernetes_version_used` instead

kubernetes_version_min.description: The minimum Kubernetes version, this field is always nil. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html). To get the current kubernetes version being used for your cluster, use the `kubernetes_version_used` field.

kubernetes_version_used.description: Full Kubernetes version used. For example, if `1.22` was selected, this value may result to `1.22.15`

enable_kubernetes_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the Kubernetes version.

enable_machine_image_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the OS image version.

end.description: Date time for maintenance window end.

start.description: Date time for maintenance window start.

maintenance.description: A single maintenance block as defined below

id.description: ID of the STACKIT Network Area (SNA) network into which the cluster will be deployed.

availability_zones.description: Specify a list of availability zones.

labels.description: Labels to add to each node.

max_surge.description: The maximum number of nodes upgraded simultaneously.

max_unavailable.description: The maximum number of nodes unavailable during upgraded.

maximum.description: Maximum number of nodes in the pool.

minimum.description: Minimum number of nodes in the pool.

name.description: Specifies the name of the node pool.

os_name.description: The name of the OS image.

os_version_min.description: The minimum OS image version, this field is always nil. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html). To get the current OS image version being used for the node pool, use the read-only `os_version_used` field.

os_version_used.description: Full OS image version used. For example, if 3815.2 was set in `os_version_min`, this value may result to 3815.2.2. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [Updates for Kubernetes versions and Operating System versions in SKE](https://docs.stackit.cloud/stackit/en/version-updates-in-ske-10125631.html).
